title: Naive hand printed script used on Juno promotion
content:
I’m fairly sure this is a downloaded font because of where it was used, but I’m not sure. Does anyone know what font this is?

Thanks for any help!

| --- | --- |
| [2rx8x9s.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415214001/http:/typophile.com/files/2rx8x9s_0.gif) | 108.99 KB |

author: Chelsea Flattery

comments.content: Don’t know the font but I’m sure I’m gonna hate that movie too. It’s probably this year’s “Little Miss Sunshine”
It’s last years Juno. No idea about the font though.
It’s a cute film if you can stomach the dialog.

\> _I’m gonna hate that movie too._

_Little Miss Sunshine_ was frickin’ funny, and _Juno_ is supposed to be a good movie as well. :^P

I was wondering if I’d enjoy _Little Miss Sunshine_. There were parts that were trying too hard. For instance, the son reads Nietzsche but when he finally expresses his anger at the world (the 2 times actually) his vocabulary is reduced to a bunch of 4 letter words. I’d have assumed he’d be able to be more articulate. The little girl was adorable though and the point made by the entire movie was nice.
I think the reading Nietsche bit was more a way of making himself look cool. I fear his whole attitude was just that — attitude. ;^)
Yes. That is what I concluded too. I wanted to hug him anyway because his character reminded me of my nephew who is going through that stage of life right now too.

_Juno_ is _Napoleon Dynamite_ with a female lead and a plot. Sort of.

That was a compliment.

I liked the movie, but I liked the soundtrack even more. The music from the film is as naive as the font you’re looking for.

Try one of the many handwritten fonts on DaFont: [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=603](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415214001/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=603)
